description.narrative: At the end of the intervention, it is expected that the contribution has contributed to the following objectives: - The recommendations of the economic conference are effectively implemented and contribute to strengthening the gender dimensions of the economic reforms;- The reform of the legal framework in Sudan is guided by a strong commitment to promoting equal rights for women and men; - An enabling environment to guarantee women representation in decision-making positions in line with the Constitutional Declaration and the BPFA is promoted;- The capacity of government institutions is developed to support the effectiveness of the gender agenda in different sectors. - The National Bureau of Statistics is well equipped to generate gender-responsive data in support of mainstreaming gender in different sectors. The proposed interventions are in line with the Theory of Change (ToC) underlying the development results of UN-Women’s Strategic Plan, 2018-2021. It is also aligned with the Swedish strategy for Sudan 2018-2022.

UN Women har ansökt att från Sida få ett stöd på 14,2 MSEK (1,476,360 USD) för att genomföra projektet ”Strengthening the gender architecture in Sudan 2020-2022.” UN Women kommer att använda bidraget för att sekondera nationella jämställdhetsrådgivare som ska placerar på ministerium som anses viktiga för att tillvarata kvinnors rättigheter i Sudan. Bland dessa är premiärministerns kontor, finansdepartementet och justitiedepartementet. Jämställdhetsrådgivarna har efterfrågats av respektive ministerium.
Stöd kommer också att gå till UN Women för att följa upp insatsen. En koordineringsstuktur mellan ministerierna har utvecklats för att koordinera och förstärka insatsen. Sverige är ensam givare.

UN Women has applied for a support of 14,2 MSEK ( USD 1,476,360) from Sida to implement the project "Strengthening the gender architecture in Sudan 2019-2022."
UN Women will use the support to finance national gender advisers to be placed in ministries that are considered essential for the protection of women's rights in Sudan. The supported ministries have requested the Gender advisers. Some of the ministries are the Prime Ministers office, Ministry of Justice and Ministry of finance. Support will also go to UN Women to follow up on the effort. A coordination structure between the ministries has been developed to coordinate and strengthen the operation. Sweden is the sole donor.
